intro: Anthodiscus amazonicus, commonly known as the Amazonian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has palmately lobed leaves. Anthodiscus amazonicus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
